Feature9994, Feature9995, Feature9996, FeatureBilingualMistranslations, FeatureBilingualTranslations, FeatureMonolingualTerms

    public abstract class Feature
extends java.lang.Object
    Feature is an abstract class which models a sentence feature. Typiclally, a Feature consist of a value, a procedure for calculating the value and a set of dependencies, i.e., resources that need to be available in order to be able to compute the feature value.
    Classes extending Feature will have to provide their own method for computing the feature value by implementing Modified by José de Souza (desouza@fbk.eu) - the value attribute was transformed into a HashMap; - the get*() and set*() methods were updated accordingly; - each value in the hash corresponds to a different feature and the feature counter is automatically incremented every time it is used. The counter starts at 0. When a new value is added the counter is incremented and point to the last inserted key.
    See Also:
    Feature.run

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the internal state of the Feature object. The actual implementation clears the values of the feature and reinitializes the feature counter.
